required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.official_title: Use of Nomogram for Predictions of Ocular Mysathenia Gravis Generalization

brief_summary.textblock: Secondary ocular myasthenia gravis (OMG) generalization represents a pejorative evolution and no validated generalization prevention strategy exists. The aim of this observational study was to determine the percentage of patients with OMG generalization and identify factors predictive of that pejorative evolution. Data from patients with OMG registered in the Fondation Hospital A. de Rothschild database between January 1990 and January 2017 were collected. Among the 183 patients registered in this database, 151 patients with available informations were analyzed.

primary_outcome.description: Kaplan-meier survival estimations, descriptive and multivariate Cox model analyses were computed (age at onset, first year anti-acetylcholine receptor antibody positivity, electromyogram decrement, steroid use).

intervention.intervention_name: Use of nomogram for predictions of Ocular Mysathenia Gravis generalization
intervention.description: The outcome measure was time to Myasthenia gravis generalization. The explanatory variables were age at onset, sex, first-year anti-acetylcholinereceptor antibody positivity, repetiting nerve stimulation showing electromyogram decrement and steroid use. Kaplan-Meier survival estimations, descriptive and multivariate Cox model analyses were computed. A nomogram combining explanatory vraiables was used to establish a score to predict the probability of OMG generalization.

study_pop.textblock: Patients with OMG diagnosis and its generalization who consulted between January 1990 to January 2017 at Fondation Hospital Adolphe de Rothschild and registered in the database

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients with OMG diagnosis and its generalization who consulted between January 1990 to January 2017 at Fondation Hospital Adolphe de Rothschild and registered in the database
Exclusion Criteria:
- OMG differential diagnoses
